title: Credit Suisse, Deutsche Bank-Backed Taurus Deploys on Polygon Blockchain
description: The Swiss firm aims to allow financial institutions and corporates to issue tokenized assets on the Ethereum layer 2 network.

title: Solving Lightning’s ‘Inbound Liquidity’ Problem is Focus of New Layer 2 Bitcoin Protocol Ark
description: The new protocol’s 24-year-old creator says Lightning’s inbound liquidity requirement - requiring users to commit funds to the protocol even when they're just receiving payments – “doesn’t make any sense.”

title: U.S. unemployment rate comes in at 3.7%, Bitcoin holds $27K
description:
Quick Take The U.S. unemployment rate broke the expected 3.5%, coming in at 3.7%. May nonfarm payrolls were projected at 190,000, but instead came in at +339,000. Bitcoin traded at $27,000, slightly down by the spike in unemployment.

The post U.S. unemployment rate comes in at 3.7%, Bitcoin holds $27K appeared first on CryptoSlate.

title: Digital Currency Group faces legal quagmire as class-action lawsuits pile up
description: In a dramatic turn of events, Digital Currency Group (DCG), a prominent venture capital firm specializing in cryptocurrencies, finds itself entangled in a legal quagmire as class-action lawsuits mount and the future of its prime brokerage subsidiary hangs in the balance. DCG, led by its CEO Barry Silbert, recently requested to consolidate two class-action lawsuits ... Read more

title: CleanSpark purchases new S19 XP bitcoin miners amid crypto winter
description: CleanSpark has announced the purchase of 12,500 units of the Antminer S19 XP bitcoin mining machines for a sum of $40.5 million. Once CleanSpark receives a shipment of the miners, its total hash rate is expected to reach 16 eta…

description:

title: U.S. Debt Ceiling Sparks Caution, Casts Doubt on Crypto and Equity Markets
description:
In a significant development, the U.S. Senate passed bipartisan legislation on June 2, receiving crucial backing from President Joe Biden, lifting the government’s debt ceiling of $31.4 trillion. The debt ceiling refers to the maximum amount of money that the U.S. government can borrow to meet its financial obligations. By surpassing the previous limit, the […]
